climb.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to move up, down, or across something using your feet and hands, especially when this is difficult to do
climb.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Boys were climbing trees along the river bank.
The wall is too high to climb over.
They climbed up into the loft of the old barn.
climb.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to increase in number, amount, or level
climb.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The temperature has climbed steadily since this morning.
The divorce rate had climbed to almost 30% of all marriages.
climb.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to move into, out of, or through something slowly and awkwardly
climb.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The bus pulled in, and we climbed aboard.
John climbed through the window into the kitchen.
I turned the TV on and climbed into bed.
climb.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to move gradually to a higher position
climb.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: The roller coaster climbs 91 feet and reaches speeds of 45 miles an hour.
The path climbs high into the hills.
The plane climbed to 11,600 feet to try to get above the clouds.
climb.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: to climb mountains or rocks as a sport
climb.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: Hillary and Tenzing were the first men to climb Mount Everest.
She loves to hike and climb.
climb.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: to grow up a wall or other structure
climb.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: to move higher in a list of teams, records etc as you become more popular or successful
climb.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: The song climbed to number two in the US charts.
climb.translation[0].definitions[7].defi: to move to a better position in your social or professional life
climb.translation[0].definitions[7].exam: Steve climbed rapidly in the sales division.
men who climbed the career ladder in the 1980s
climb.translation[0].note_box[0].section: climb
to move up, down, or across something using your hands and feet
Most kids love climbing trees.
Several fans climbed onto the roof of the arena to get a better view.
She climbed down the ladder.
ascend
to climb up something
He began to ascend the narrow winding staircase.
the first man to ascend Mount Everest
go up
to climb up something such as a slope or stairs
He went up the steps to the platform.
Sonia was quiet as they went up the hill.
scale
to climb to the top of something such as a high wall or fence
Somehow the men had scaled the twenty-foot wall without setting off the alarm.
Protestors scaled the walls of the building and hung banners.
Rescuers had to scale a one-thousand-foot cliff before they could reach the injured climber.
clamber
to climb somewhere with difficulty, using your hands to help you
At last we saw the two girls clambering down the slope to safety.
Everyone clambered onto the back of the truck.
scramble
to climb somewhere quickly and with difficulty, using your hands to help you, especially when you are walking
They scrambled up the steep rocky bank.
climb.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a process in which you move up towards a place, especially while using a lot of effort
climb.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: a long steady climb to the top
climb.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: an increase in value or amount
climb.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The dollar continued its climb against the yen.
a steady climb in house prices
climb.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: the process of improving something, especially your professional or social position
climb.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: a slow climb out of the recession
the Labour Party’s climb to power
climb.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: a process in which someone or something reaches a higher position in a list or in a competition because of being popular or successful
climb.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: the Giants’ climb from twelfth to fifth in the league
the song’s steady climb up the charts
climb.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: a steep rock, cliff, or mountain that you climb up
climb.translation[1].definitions[4].exam: one of the hardest rock climbs in the world
